As occurred in the 2003 SARS epidemic,
36 the SARS-CoV-2 virus can damage the heart, which may in turn lead to cardioembolic stroke. Acute myocardial damage, detected by presence of elevated troponin levels, was detected in 15% of patients in one series
16 and in 17% in another, in which it was also associated with morbidity and mortality
37 ; in a third study, 16.7% of patients developed arrhythmic complications, with 7% presenting acute myocardial infarction.
14 Seven percent of deaths were attributed to myocarditis.
